articles.title: City Council rejects effort to ask Wu administration for info on ICE detainer requests
articles.description:
In accordance with a city law, the Boston Police Department ignored every detainer request ICE sent to the city last year.

The post City Council rejects effort to ask Wu administration for info on ICE detainer requests appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: City Council voted against requesting ICE detainer information from the Wu administration.
Boston Police Department ignored all ICE detainer requests in 2022, per city law.
This decision affects local immigrant communities and their interactions with law enforcement.

articles.title: Here’s why Boston streets seem clearer than after the last big storm
articles.description:
“I think we have made a huge amount of headway with this most recent blizzard in getting everything back up and running in Boston,” Mayor Michelle Wu said.

The post Here’s why Boston streets seem clearer than after the last big storm appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Mayor Michelle Wu reports significant progress in snow removal after the recent blizzard.
Boston streets are clearer compared to previous storms, enhancing mobility for residents.
Efficient snow management aims to improve public safety and access to city services.

articles.title: This Mass. bride and groom skied Killington fresh off their vows and in wedding attire
articles.description:

summary: Massachusetts couple skied at Killington immediately after their wedding ceremony.

Their unique celebration highlights local winter sports culture and wedding trends.

articles.title: Report: Anfernee Simons played with wrist fracture during time with Celtics

Simons' condition raises concerns about player health and management for local fans.

articles.title: Boston Fleet focused on games ahead, not recent slight of US women’s hockey team by Trump

articles.title: MBTA Commuter Rail experiences more delays due to snow cleanup and vehicle on track
articles.description:
"Cleanup efforts are continuing, with nearly three feet of snow along some parts of the network," a spokesperson said.

The post MBTA Commuter Rail experiences more delays due to snow cleanup and vehicle on track appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: MBTA Commuter Rail faces delays due to ongoing snow cleanup efforts.
Nearly three feet of snow affects parts of the network, complicating services.
Boston residents should expect continued disruptions in their daily commutes.
